description: This function generates a 2x2 grid of bar graphs in a single image, each representing a different set of categorical data. It is designed to facilitate comparison and analysis of different data sets, making it a useful tool for teaching data visualization and analysis in an educational setting.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Multi Bar Graphs
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'create_multi_bar_graph' function can draw a 2x2 grid of bar graphs, each representing a different set of categorical data. It accepts a MultiGraphList containing exactly 4 CategoricalGraph objects as input. Each CategoricalGraph object should contain a list of categories and their corresponding frequencies, a title, and labels for the x and y axes. The function is designed to facilitate comparison and analysis of different data sets, making it a useful tool for teaching data visualization and analysis in an educational setting. It is important to note that the function requires exactly 4 sets of data, and will raise a ValueError if this condition is not met.

details: MultiGraphList: A list containing exactly 4 CategoricalGraph objects
CategoricalGraph: An object that contains a list of categories and their corresponding frequencies, a title, and labels for the x and y axes
Category: A string representing a category
Frequency: A number representing the frequency of a category
Title: A string representing the title of the graph
x_axis_label: A string representing the label for the x axis
y_axis_label: A string representing the label for the y axis
The MultiGraphList must contain exactly 4 CategoricalGraph objects
The categories and frequencies must be lists of the same length
The title, x_axis_label, and y_axis_label must be strings
The function draws a 2x2 grid of bar graphs in a single image
Each bar graph represents a different set of categorical data
The height of each bar corresponds to the frequency of the category it represents
The title and labels for the x and y axes are displayed on each graph
The function uses smart x-axis label management to ensure that the labels are displayed clearly and legibly

educational_standards.description: Draw a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories
